Package model

Class User

java.lang.Object
model.User
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
User class that functions mostly as a wrapper class for several albums. This class's data can be serialized, and should be loaded from the file system when a user logs in.
Author:
John Hoban, Kaushal Patel
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User​(java.lang.String name) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.io.IOException
      Create a new user by name. Doesn't allow two users with the same name on the same machine.
      Parameters:
      name - Username
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a user with this name already exists.
      java.io.IOException - if there is a problem creating the save file.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Get this user's username.
      Returns:
      The username.

    • getAlbums

      public java.util.List<Album> getAlbums()
      Get a read-only copy of this user's albums. The albums themselves are mutable, but adds and deletes are not allowed.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable List instance containing each album this user owns.

    • createAlbum

      public Album createAlbum​(java.lang.String name) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new album for this user. A user cannot own two albums with the same name.
      Parameters:
      name - Album name.
      Returns:
      Instance of the new Album.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an existing album has this name.

    • deleteAlbum

      public boolean deleteAlbum​(Album album)
      Deletes an album from the user's collection.
      Parameters:
      album - The album to be deleted.
      Returns:
      true if delete was successful, false otherwise.

    • save

      public void save() throws java.io.IOException
      Save this user's data to the filesystem via serialization.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if user save file is missing.

    • load

      public static User load​(java.lang.String name) throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Load a user object from a data file, given the name of the desired user.
      Parameters:
      name - Username.
      Returns:
      A user object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the classpath for this class is not found
      java.io.IOException - if the user save file can't be accessed
